alert.note: Alert for Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 5:51AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Locally Strong Southwest Winds Early This Morning... A cold front will sweep across far northeastern Missouri and far southeastern Iowa early this morning, leading to some locally strong wind gusts. Gusty southwest winds between 30 to 40 MPH have been observed behind the front, along with some isolated 45 MPH gusts. These localized gusts will likely last through 9 AM this morning. These gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle on east-west roads.
